personalInfo.family: Wife, Leslie; Charles Workman (9/18/95), Mary Elizabeth (11/3/97), Robert Andrew (11/12/99)

tourBios.curYearHigh: Playing on a sponsor exemption, used a final-round 69 to move into a T8 at the Dick's Sporting Goods Open, his career-best effort on the Champions Tour.
tourBios.carHigh:
Member of Web.com Tour in 1990-91, 1993-95, 1997 and 2001-03. Member of PGA TOUR in 1992-93 and 1998-2000.

2014: Made four starts on the Champions Tour, finishing T33, T43, T45, T55 in his debut season.

2003: Played in 25 Web.com Tour events, making four cuts. Best finish was a T10 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open. Recorded four under-par rounds at Crestview CC, including a third-round, 9-under 63. 

2002: Finished No. 75 on the final money list on the 2002 Web.com Tour...Made the cut in 12 of 21 events, with five top-25 finishes...Notched his only top-10 at the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic. Posted rounds of 68-70-70-72 to finish 4-under-par 280, collecting a season-best $14,085...Other top finishes came at the Lake Erie Charity Classic at Peek 'n Peak Resort (T12), Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open (T12), Dayton Open (T14) and SAS Carolina Classic (T15)...Missed the cut at the Buick Invitational in his only appearance on the 2002 PGA TOUR.

2001: Made the cut in 13 of 24 Web.com Tour events in 2001 with four top-25 finishes...Had his best showing of the year in his home state at the Steamtown Classic in Scranton, Pa. Posted rounds of 70-70-67-71 to T9.

2000: Had his second-best season on the PGA TOUR but just missed keeping his card by finishing No. 162 on the money list.

1999: Played in 38 PGA TOUR events with two top-25 finishes.

1998: Lone international victory came at the 1998 Panama Open...All three career top-10 PGA TOUR finishes came in most lucrative year when he posted a career-best, second-place finish at the Bell Canadian Open after losing in a playoff to Billy Andrade. Was T7 at the Honda Classic and T6 at the GTE Byron Nelson Classic.

1997: Fired final-round 63 on last day of the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament to earn exempt status...Finished inside the top 50 on the Web.com Tour money list in five of his eight seasons...Had three top-10s on the Web.com Tour, including a T3 at the Shreveport Open.

1994: Had 10 top-25 finishes. The best were two third-place showings--at the Monterrey Open and the Panama City Beach Classic.

1993: Among his three top-10s in 1993 were a second at the Mississippi Gulf Coast Classic, where he lost to Jim Furyk in a playoff, and a T3 at the Tri-Cities Open.

1991: Earned his first victory at the 1991 Fort Wayne Open.

1990: Ended the season with his first second-place finish, at the El Paso Open, two strokes back of Mike Springer.

1989: Split his time between the Southern Africa Tour and the Canadian Tour.

1988: Played his first season on the Southern Africa Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Winner of 1985 Pennsylvania State Amateur and three tournaments in 1986, including the Northeast Amateur, Monroe Amateur and Mid-Atlantic Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Worked as club professional at Inverness CC before returning to competitive golf in 1997...Son of former Pittsburgh Pirates pitcher Bob Friend...College teammate of former TOUR player Emlyn Aubrey...Analyst for PGA TOUR Network on Sirius/XM radio...Director of Operations at Pikewood National GC in Morgantown, W. Va...Twitter name is @bobfriend_golf.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was 1st in 1991 at the Ben Hogan Ft. Wayne Open.
